channel.title: CyberNetSec - Industrial Control Systems
channel.description: Latest industrial control systems threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: OSCE Guide Urges Unified Cyber-Physical Defense for Critical Infrastructure
item.description:
The Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) has published a new technical guide advising governments and operators to adopt a unified approach to securing critical infrastructure. The guide emphasizes the growing convergence of physical and cybersecurity domains, warning that silo...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Policy and Compliance, Security Operations

item.title: Chinese-Made Electric Buses in Europe & Australia Pose Remote Shutdown Risk
item.description:
Cybersecurity tests conducted in Norway on November 7, 2025, have uncovered a significant security risk in Chinese-manufactured Yutong electric buses, which are widely used across Europe and Australia. The 'Lion Cage' experiment demonstrated that the buses' connected systems could theoretically be a...

Severity: High

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Cyberattack, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Patient Sabotage: Malicious NuGet Packages with Time-Delayed ICS Payloads Discovered
item.description:
Security researchers have discovered nine malicious packages on the NuGet repository, downloaded over 9,400 times, containing hidden, time-delayed sabotage code. One package, 'Sharp7Extend,' was specifically designed to corrupt write operations in industrial control systems (ICS) by silently causing...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Industrial Control Systems, Malware

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA Warns of Critical ICS Flaws in Fuji, Delta, and Radiometrics Systems
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has released five advisories detailing critical vulnerabilities in Industrial Control Systems (ICS) from Fuji Electric, Survision, Delta Electronics, Radiometrics, and IDIS. The flaws, which include buffer overflows and authentication ...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Vulnerability, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Hackers Claim Breach and Full Database Theft from Russian Nuclear Waste Facility 'Radon'
item.description:
A threat actor has posted on a data leak forum claiming to have breached Radon, a Russian state-owned enterprise responsible for nuclear waste management and operated by the nuclear giant Rosatom. The attackers allege they have stolen the company's entire database, which reportedly includes sensitiv...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Data Breach, Industrial Control Systems

item.title: Everest Ransomware Hits Swedish Power Grid Operator, Steals 280GB of Data
item.description:
Sweden's national electricity operator, Svenska kraftnät, has confirmed a data breach following a claim by the Everest ransomware group. The attackers alleged on their dark web leak site that they had stolen 280 GB of internal data. Svenska kraftnät stated that the attack was confined to an external...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Data Breach, Industrial Control Systems

Read Full Article →

item.title: Canada Issues National Alert as Hacktivists Target Critical Infrastructure
item.description:
The Canadian Centre for Cyber Security, along with the RCMP, has issued a national alert warning of increasing cyberattacks by hacktivists against the nation's critical infrastructure. The advisory follows multiple successful breaches of internet-accessible Industrial Control Systems (ICS) in sector...

Severity: High

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Policy and Compliance, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA Warns of Critical Flaws in Global Fuel Gauge Systems, Risking Infrastructure Disruption
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has issued a critical advisory for two vulnerabilities in Veeder-Root's TLS4B Automatic Tank Gauge (ATG) systems, which are used globally to monitor fuel levels. The most severe flaw, CVE-2025-58428, has a CVSS score of 9.9 and could a...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Vulnerability, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: U.S. Coast Guard Poised for 'Generational Change' in Maritime Cybersecurity with $25B Funding
item.description:
The U.S. Coast Guard (USCG) is set for a 'generational change' in maritime cybersecurity, according to an analysis by the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS). Nearly $25 billion in new funding, combined with expanded regulatory authorities, will allow the USCG to comprehensively mo...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Industrial Control Systems

item.title: DDoS Attack on Russian Food Agency Cripples National Supply Chains
item.description:
Russia's federal agency for veterinary and phytosanitary surveillance, Rosselkhoznadzor, has been targeted by a large-scale distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack starting October 22, 2025. The attack crippled the agency's critical electronic certification systems, including the 'Mercury' platf...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Industrial Control Systems, Policy and Compliance
